answers.answer: My husband had the same thing and for a long time he ignored it.  It got worse and after many trips to the dr. they send him to a foot specialist.  He has plantar fasciitis.  His foot seems to bother him most when he gets up in the morning or if he has been sitting a long time.  He now has insoles that are made for his feet and it seems to be improving.  Hope this helps!!

question: Hello - 4 months ago i gave birth to twins - as a result of IVF i am 40.  I had preeclampsia and ended up having an emergency c sections.  Babies are well.  I had loads of pregnancy symptons but have developed a new issue since they were born - although i dont know whether it is connected.  When i wake in the morning i have quite alot of trouble walking its like a painful ache in my feet, also happens when i have been stationary for a long period.  Disappears after about 10 minutes and then i am fine.  Asked my doctor and she didnt really have any ideas however she did send me for some blood tests the only result which came back is that i have a vitamin D deficiency and i received a very standard letter from the doctor saying i should take supplements, have had no further correspondance with the GP.  Have started taking the supplements for last 2 weeks but am not noticing a difference - the letter was standard and hence  dont know whether they are saying this is the reason for the problem although obviously it is something which needs to be addressed.   i had no problems like this during pregnancy or before.  Any thoughts much appreciated am a bit concerned about it.
title: Foot ache/pain when walking after stationary periods
